Dr. Sarah Chen

HCI Researcher

Human-computer interaction (HCI) researcher focused on designing ethical and user-centric AI systems

Dr. Sarah Chen

Dr. Sarah Chen is a leading researcher in artificial intelligence with a focus on natural language processing and ethical AI development. She has published extensively on transformer architectures and bias mitigation in language models.

Research Areas

  • Natural Language Processing
  • Ethical AI Development
  • Transformer Architectures
  • Bias Mitigation

Publications

  • Multiple papers on AI ethics and NLP
  • Contributor to major AI conferences

Background

Dr. Chen received her PhD from Stanford University and currently works as a senior researcher at a major tech company’s AI research lab.
